section.name: Overview
section.p: All released Apache artifacts are normally signed. This signing is different from Eclipse Plugin JAR signing. If Eclipse Plugin JARs are not signed with a recognized authority certificate, when you install the plugin, the Eclipse installer says you are installing unsigned artifacts, and needs permission to continue.
This page describes how the Eclipse plugin release process is set up for JAR signing.

section.name: Release Manager needs to have a valid code signing certificate
section.p: For the UIMA project, contact the PMC chair for aid in obtaining a code signing certificate if you need one.

section.name: Release only if 1 or more changed Eclipse plugins
section.p: If the release does not have any updates to Eclipse Plugin JARs, save Apache money by reusing previously released versions. If the release has 1 or more JARs, these will be signed in 1 signing event. so it doesn't matter how many Jars there are.

section.name: Links to Apache resources for codesigning
section.p: See https://wiki.eclipse.org/JAR_Signing#What_gets_signed.3F for background on signing Eclipse Plugins.
